meanings.definition: Handle or control (a tool, mechanism, etc.) in a skillful manner.
meanings.sent1: She manipulated the paintbrush with precision.
meanings.sent2: He manipulated the steering wheel smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The magician manipulated the cards effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers manipulated the strings of the guitar like a puppeteer.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor manipulated the clay into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: Influence or control (a person or situation) cleverly or unscrupulously.
meanings.sent1: The politician manipulated the crowd with his persuasive speech.
meanings.sent2: She manipulated her friends into going along with her plan.
meanings.sent3: The cat manipulated its owner into giving extra treats.
meanings.sent4: His words manipulated the outcome of the debate.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind manipulated the situation to his advantage.

meanings.definition: Alter or present (data) so as to mislead.
meanings.sent1: The researcher manipulated the graph to show false results.
meanings.sent2: He manipulated the evidence to frame someone else.
meanings.sent3: The prankster manipulated the photo to trick his friends.
meanings.sent4: The hacker manipulated the code to gain unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The spy manipulated the information to deceive the enemy.
